summary: Brittany Wang hosts a video explaining the Kindle read-aloud feature and its applications in book editing and writing.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt and a necklace, is seated in a cozy, well-decorated room. She appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as indicated by her expressive facial expressions and hand gestures. The background features a bookshelf filled with various books, a vase with yellow flowers, and a vintage typewriter, creating a warm and intellectual atmosphere. A framed map is visible on the wall, adding to the room's aesthetic. Throughout the video, the woman's expressions and gestures change, suggesting she is actively communicating. At one point, text appears at the bottom of the screen, reading "www.AuthorBrittanyWang.com," indicating that the woman may be discussing her work or promoting her authorship. The overall setting and her demeanor convey a sense of professionalism and passion for her subject matter.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker expressing surprise and explaining that the Kindle app can read aloud any book, "effectively turning your book into a kind of audio book," suggesting this can help with editing. The speaker sounds excited and asks if others were unaware of this feature, sharing a personal goal of having her book as an audio book and stating, "my mind is officially blown right now." The clip concludes with music, possibly a short musical interlude, playing a soft, pleasant tune.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, seated in a cozy room filled with bookshelves, a vintage typewriter, and a vase of yellow flowers. She appears to be speaking directly to the camera, engaging with the audience. Throughout the video, various text overlays appear, including "HOW TO PUT YOUR NOVEL ON YOUR KINDLE APP!" and "SELFEEDITING MY BOOK USING:" accompanied by an image of a person sitting on a chair. Additionally, a comment section is shown, with one comment reading, "Very helpful video, Brittany! I like to have the Kindle read my book to me, so I can review it while I watch my kids at the park. Multi-tasking!" and a reply from "Author Brittany Wang" expressing surprise and asking for instructions on how to make the Kindle read the book aloud. The video concludes with a text overlay encouraging viewers to "Go check out 'Fiction Technician' on YouTube!" The woman's expressions and gestures suggest she is explaining or discussing the topics mentioned in the text overlays, creating an informative and engaging atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a female speaker backing up and telling how she came across amazing information. She mentions that in some recent videos she showed how to put a young adult fantasy novel draft into an ebook format so it can be read on a Kindle. She adds that while chatting in the comments she got talking to another YouTuber, Fiction Technician, who said she likes to have Kindle read her books too so she can review them while she watches her kids at the park. The female speaker was shocked and asked her to teach her ways. She then thanks Jane for sharing these tips with her so she can share the steps with the viewers. She adds that in order to show how it works in the end, she is going to have Kindle read the first page of her novel, which she hasn't done publicly yet. Lastly, she says to stay tuned but that they should get into the steps. The audio clip ends with a reading of the first page of the novel with a female reading, â€œChapter One, Fire, I called again into the night."

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, is seated in a cozy room filled with bookshelves and a vintage typewriter. She appears to be speaking, using hand gestures to emphasize her points. The background features a vase of yellow flowers and a framed map on the wall, creating a warm and intellectual atmosphere. As she continues to speak, an image of a child reading a book under a starry sky appears on the screen, symbolizing the joy of reading. The woman then points to a smartphone screen displaying the 'Settings' menu, specifically highlighting the 'Accessibility' options. She navigates through the settings, focusing on the 'Spoken Content' section, which includes features like 'Speak Selection' and 'Speak Screen.' The video effectively combines the woman's engaging presentation with visual aids to convey the importance of accessibility features in enhancing the reading experience.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker explaining the upcoming steps will be demonstrated on an iPhone, and encourages viewers with Android phones to provide steps in the comments. She mentions she will include instructions in the description. The speaker continues by stating users with iPhones will need to load the Kindle app. Then the speaker will go to the phone's settings. The speaker mentions her notes are over here and says to scroll down to accessibility and then go to spoken content. She then instructs the listener to click pretty much everything on the page. The speaker mentions speak selection and to make sure that is enabled. The clip ends with a click sound.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, is seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books. She appears to be explaining or demonstrating the accessibility features of a smartphone. The screen of the phone is visible, displaying the 'Accessibility' settings menu, specifically the 'Spoken Content' section. The woman gestures with her hands as she navigates through the settings, toggling options such as 'Speak Selection,' 'Speak Screen,' and 'Speech Controller.' The background includes a desk with a typewriter and a container holding pens and pencils, adding to the cozy, intellectual atmosphere of the setting. The video focuses on the woman's interaction with the phone's accessibility features, highlighting the ease of use and functionality of these settings.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a female speaker discussing how to use Speak Screen on the Kindle app, explaining that it allows the app to read an entire page and turn pages automatically, and then how to turn on the speech controller for the app. She describes this as a control area to play, rewind, select pages, or speed up or slow down the reader. She characterizes this aspect as "really fun".

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, is seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books. She is holding a smartphone and appears to be explaining or demonstrating something related to the phone's settings. The phone screen displays the 'Accessibility' settings, specifically the 'Spoken Content' section, which includes options like 'Speak Selection,' 'Speak Screen,' 'Speech Controller,' 'Highlight Content,' 'Typing Feedback,' 'Voices,' 'Speaking Rate,' and 'Pronunciations.' The woman gestures with her hands, pointing to the screen and touching the 'Voices' option, which opens a list of voice options under the 'English' category. She scrolls through the list, selecting 'Karen,' an enhanced voice option, and then returns to the 'Spoken Content' settings screen, where she points to the 'Karen' voice option, indicating her selection. The background includes a desk with a typewriter and various stationery items, creating a cozy and intellectual atmosphere. The woman's facial expressions and hand movements suggest she is engaged in a detailed explanation or tutorial about the phone's accessibility features.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single female speaking in an excited tone. She highlights the feature of choosing a voice to read a book and explains that this is the closest one can get to doing real auditions for a reader. The speaker describes how to find the voices, explaining that there are a bunch of different languages and accents to choose from. She particularly enjoys listening to British or Australian accents and details her experience of trying different accents with Kindle to see how they would sound with her book. The woman shares her choice of the Australian accent and clarifies there are different options for each accent, such as the "normal" version and an "enhanced" version, which she interprets as meaning the voice sounds smoother or more natural. A brief sample of two versions of a female voice saying "Hello, my name is Karen" is played to demonstrate the difference between the regular and "enhanced" options. The initial speaker returns and points out the download options available for additional voices.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, is seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books. She appears to be speaking and gesturing with her hands, possibly explaining or discussing something. To her right, a smartphone screen is visible, displaying a list of voice options in English, including names like Allison, Fred, Nicky, Samantha, and others, with additional options for different accents and genders. The background includes a desk with a typewriter and other items, creating a cozy, intellectual atmosphere. The woman's expressions and gestures suggest she is engaged in a detailed explanation or demonstration related to the voice options on the phone.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a female speaker discussing voice technologies in a conversational tone, acknowledging their robotic quality and limitations, especially concerning pause issues. She then explains that this method is not perfect but useful for reviewing drafts. She emphasizes its potential to aid in editing, improve dialogue, flow, pacing, and give the listener's eyes a rest from the written word. She encourages the listener to experience the book as a story being told aloud.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, is seated in a cozy room filled with books on shelves behind her. She appears to be speaking, as indicated by her hand gestures and facial expressions. To her right, a smartphone screen displays a list of English voices, including names like Allison, Fred, Nicky, Samantha, and others, with options to select different voices. The room is decorated with a vase of yellow flowers, a typewriter, and a framed picture on the wall, creating a warm and intellectual atmosphere. At one point, a text overlay appears at the bottom of the screen, reading "Learn more at: AuthorBrittanyWang.com/Books," suggesting that the woman is promoting her books. The video maintains a consistent setting and focus on the woman as she engages with the audience, likely discussing her work or the process of selecting a voice for her audiobooks.
events_list.audio_caption: A female speaker expresses personal preference for a narrator, explaining the choice is due to the character's voice. Enthusiastically, the speaker introduces listening to the first page of their current book draft, noting that it is being reworked based on beta feedback. The speaker expresses pride in the work, though acknowledges there's much more to change and improve.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, is seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books. She appears to be discussing a book titled "On Wings of Ash & Dust" by Brittany Wang, as indicated by the book cover displayed on the right side of the screen. The cover features an image of ships on a stormy sea, with the title and author's name prominently displayed. The woman gestures with her hands as she speaks, occasionally pointing to the book cover. The background includes a typewriter, a vase with yellow flowers, and a framed picture on the wall. As the video progresses, the woman continues to talk, and the book cover remains visible. At one point, a graphic appears on the screen with the text "HOW TO PUT YOUR NOVEL ON YOUR KINDLE APP!" and an arrow pointing to a placeholder text "YOUR NOVEL HERE." The woman continues to speak and gesture, and the book cover is replaced by a screenshot of the book's first chapter, displayed on a Kindle device. The chapter begins with the text "Fire! I called out into the night," and the woman points to the text as she discusses it. The video maintains a consistent setting throughout, with the bookshelf, typewriter, and other background elements remaining unchanged.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a female speaker referencing a book cover, explaining it is a homemade version.  She clarifies steps on how to do this are in previous videos and suggests listening to the book itself. She instructs the listener to open up the Kindle app to a book previously downloaded and mentions videos are available to demonstrate converting a Word document into an e-book. The female speaker then describes swiping to a chapter in the Kindle app, clicking the player, and pressing the hand icon to start reading from a page. She indicates the play button could also be pressed and describes a scenario where it may start reading the wrong page. To fix this, she explains one must go to the hand icon and click the page to start on. Finally, she takes a deep breath.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, is seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books. She is holding a smartphone in her right hand, displaying a text passage on the screen. The passage, titled "CHAPTER 1," begins with the words "Fire! I called out into the night," and describes a scene involving ships and a storm. The woman appears to be reading or discussing the text, gesturing with her left hand as she speaks. The background includes a typewriter, a vase with yellow flowers, and a framed picture on the wall, creating a cozy and intellectual atmosphere. The video captures her expressions and gestures as she engages with the text, providing a sense of her thoughts and reactions to the passage.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker introducing a reading in the "voice that I picked" for her Young Adult fantasy novel, "On Wings of Ash and Dust." She excitedly shares that it's the "first page right now." Immediately after, the reading begins. A female voice reads the first chapter, narrating scenes with dramatic flair and varying intonation; the chapter details actions and descriptions of a character on a ship during a sea battle: "Chapter one, Fire," "Raising my sword high," the chaos of cannon fire, and her crew around her. The reading concludes, and the first female speaker returns, remarking on mistakes in the reading, such as reading through punctuation, as well as concluding that "that was really cool" and stating that she is "really excited".

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman with shoulder-length hair, wearing a light blue denim shirt, is seated in a cozy, well-decorated room. She is surrounded by bookshelves filled with various books, a vase with yellow flowers, and a vintage typewriter on a desk. The woman appears to be speaking and gesturing with her hands, engaging with the audience. Throughout the video, she expresses gratitude with text overlays such as "Thanks again so much Fiction Technician!! :D" and "Thanks again so much to all of you!! :D" appearing at the bottom of the screen. Additionally, a list of names is displayed, likely acknowledging contributors or supporters. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with the woman's friendly demeanor and the room's aesthetic creating a comfortable and engaging environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker expressing strong emotion. She describes how trying something for the first time after being a "fiction technician" brought her to tears, as it was "really emotional" to see her hard work transformed into a new medium. She encourages viewers to experience the joy she felt. She asks if there are other Kindle tips she's missing and wants others to share their knowledge in the comments. She asks that viewers give the video a thumbs up and subscribe if they haven't already. She mentions previous videos about turning a book into an ebook and using Kindle features, and suggests checking them out.
